// comment: Should we create named-explicit-paths and tunnels with different operations or in one operation?
Doing this in one request would have some issues when a new Tunnel is created but there are already existing named-explicit-paths  and/or tunnels

Suggestion: one POST/PUT operation, rooted on named-explicit-path/odu2-service-named-explicit-path, to create/update the ODU2 service named explicit path and one POST/PUSH operation, rooted on tunnels/tunnel/odu2-service, to create/update the ODU2 service tunnel

unnumbered-hop.// hop-type: STRICT or LOOSE (to be further discussed by the DT)
STRICT or LOOSE (to be further discussed by the DT)

tunnel.name: odu2-service

config.name: odu2-service
config.// type: Do we need this attribute since p2mp Tunnels are in the tunnel-p2mp tree?
config.description: Tunnel Segment supporting the ODU2 Transit Service in Use Case 1
config.// encoding and switching-type: Indicates this is an ODU Tunnel
config.// preference: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// reoptimize-timer: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// source: Not needed (to be discussed by the DT)
config.// destination: Not needed (to be discussed by the DT)
config.// ignore-overload: To be analyzed in a future update
// bandwidth-generic: To be discussed by the DT
The definition of ietf-te-types:te-bandwidth is a string with complex structure/parsing
Using the new ietf-te-types:te-bandwidth grouping seems simpler to indicate this is an ODU2 Tunnel
config.// disjointness: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// setup-priority: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// hold-priority: To be analyzed in a future update
config.// signaling-type: It seems that only the base path-signaling-type is defined in ietf-te-types (to be further discussed by the DT)
config.// bidirectional: Indicates this is a bidirectional co-routed Tunnel

// provisioing: It seems not relevant for the MPI (to be further discussed by the DT)

config.// ietf-otn-tunnel:payload-treatment: switching or transport? (to be further discussed by the DT)
config.// ietf-otn-tunnel:src-tpn: Is it needed? (to be further discussed by the DT)

tunnel.// bandwidth: Removed in the latest update of the TE model
